intro: Psychotria gardneriana, commonly known as the hooded psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It produces small, red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant contains various alkaloids, including psychotramine, which has been studied for its psychoactive properties.
